articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A U.S. nurse and her child have been kidnapped in Haiti, a faith-based humanitarian aid organization said on Saturday.
articles.title: US nurse, child abducted in Haiti, non-profit organization says

articles.author: Brendan O'Brien
articles.description: Tens of millions of Americans were confronted with a one-two punch of brutally hot temperatures and oppressive humidity on Friday as an unrelenting heatwave settled over the Midwest and East Coast and was expected to persist into the weekend.
articles.title: Heatwave bakes US as heat index soars past 100 degrees

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three people were injured in a shooting Saturday night during a summer carnival in the Dutch port city of Rotterdam, police said in a statement.
articles.title: Three injured in shooting in Dutch city Rotterdam

articles.author: Liz Lee, Jenny Wang, Ryan Woo
articles.description: Rain soaked northern China on Saturday as Doksuri, one of the strongest storms to hit the country in years, prompted thousands to evacuate in Beijing after pummelling the Philippines and Taiwan, and lashing China's coast.
articles.title: Weaker Doksuri drenches north China, Beijing evacuates thousands

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Nicolas Petro, son of Colombian President Gustavo Petro, has been arrested as part of an investigation into money laundering and illicit enrichment, the attorney general's office said early on Saturday.
articles.title: Colombia President Petro's son arrested in money laundering probe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: King Mohammed VI said on Saturday Morocco hopes for a return to normality and open borders with Algeria amid severed diplomatic ties.
articles.title: Morocco wants normal ties with Algeria, king says

articles.author: Graham Keeley
articles.description: Spain's Socialists have emerged with one seat fewer after counts of votes from abroad in last week's election, making it harder for them to be able to form a left-wing coalition as they would need the support of hardline Catalan separatists rather than just their abstention, analysts told Reuters on Saturday.
articles.title: Socialists lose seat, after expat vote count, making it harder to form government

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris has shown a punchy side during a tour of nearly a dozen U.S. states in recent weeks, attacking Florida Governor Ron DeSantis for backing "revisionist history" about slavery, telling Iowa healthcare workers to rebel against the state's new restrictive abortion laws and rallying Latinos in Chicago to fight "extremist" Republicans.
articles.title: Kamala Harris embraces new attack role, draws fresh Republican fire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Saturday that an African initiative could be a basis for peace in Ukraine but that Ukrainian attacks made it hard to realise.
articles.title: Putin says Russia does not reject talks with Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands of flag-waving Israelis renewed their protests nationwide after sundown on Saturday, capping a week of turmoil in which Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu pushed through a highly-contested law that limited some Supreme Court power.
articles.title: Israeli protesters keep pressure on Netanyahu after judicial turmoil
